post_message: A good Samaritan who offered his help as an AA sponsor was lured to a downtown L.A. hotel by a couple for the purpose of fulfilling "long-held fantasy" of dismembering a body, prosecutors say.  Edward Garcia was convicted of murder Tuesday in the torture and dismemberment death of Herbert Tracy White.  Prosecutors say Garcia carved up White's body with a 3 1/2-inch blade and dissected and sliced a piece of leg muscle from the bone.  Hotel employees found White's severed arms and a backpack full of flesh in the room. Under the blood-soaked bed was White's torso riddled with scratches and small punctures.  "It was a bloodbath," prosecutor John McKinney said. "They took this man apart."  Read KTLA's story here: @webpagelink
